caption.p: Diagnostic features of powdered fruits. 1. Polygonal cells of fruit epidermis (exocarp). 2. Inner layers of endocarp cells are represented by fibers, oriented askew to stone axis (2A—tangential section, 2B—transverse section). 3. Secretory canal (cross-section) in mesocarp, parenchymal cells (3A—visible oil content). 4. Outer part of the mesocarp composed of parenchymal cells containing red plastids (chromoplasts). 5. Druses in mesocarp cells located closer to the endocarp. 6. Drops of fatty oil from the endosperm. 7. Seed coat built of large cells with brown contents. Diagnostic features of the fruits. s.c.—seed coat, end.—endosperm, i.mes.—inner zone of mesocarp, s.ch.—secretory canals, s.—secretion (essential oil), dr.—druses, ch.—chromoplasts.
